radiographic_examinations.findings: A mass involving the lateral orbital musculature, with no evidence of bony erosion or invasion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Enlarged tumor mass with areas of hypodensity, consistent with necrosis at one week after chemotherapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Well-defined mass posterior and lateral to the globe, measuring 2.2 x 1.5 cm; displaced the optic nerve medially and involved the lateral and superior rectus and superior oblique muscles.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Densely enhancing mass has markedly decreased in size after chemotherapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Large mass in the right supero-lateral aspect of the orbit, indistinguishable from the superior oblique, superior rectus, and lateral rectus muscles.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Mass effect on the adjacent orbital structures has decreased, as has the proptosis after chemotherapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A very small residual soft-tissue mass that enhances with contrast material.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The residual mass has not changed in size and will be followed with serial imaging.
